column12: Fit (need to determine this through fit models)

column7: We suggest a warm underlayer for the core. The best part is this jacket looks amazing with shorts, leggings or even sweatpants.
column9: Nothing says off duty more than a sleek cropped puffer! No chance you're working out in this gem, but it sure will keep you warm.
column10: Since there is no way you are workign out in this, your brain knows you're off duty and looking good. Keep warm when your body does it post-workout chill down.

column7: Layering or solo
column9: Wear it as a layer in the winter or show off the uppers in the summer. Buttery soft, lightweight, strechy non-lycra fabric feels so well deserved. Best seller. By Beyond Yoga.
column10: Science has shown that putting on clothing that signals off-duty increases endorphins and sets in a state of relaxation. Telling the brain's fight or flight response to shut down allows the body to enter repair mode sooner. Consider wearing this tank to be the on switch for recovery.

column7: Layering or solo; perfect with loose pants or shorts
column9: Super shoulders alert! Show off the lats and shoulders with this halter tank. Also gives a peek of a toned core. Lined bra.
column10: This is for the athlete who really needs to feel like they are still at it even when they are not; this athletic fit, stretchy tank is classy but really shows off the toned work you have put in. Even with its athlethic cut, your brain will know it is not workout fabric and the recovery and rest can begin while you still look amazing. Relax it down with a pair of Not for Jogging pants.

column6: Sea Spray Green, Deep Navy, Black
column7: With high waisted leggings for an athletic style, or sweatpants for a more relaxed look
column9: Calling super shoulders and toned abs! Show off the lats and shoulders with this halter tank. Also gives a peek of a toned core. Lined bra.
column10: This is for the athlete who really needs to feel like they are still at it even when they are not; this athletic fit, super soft tank is classy but really shows off the toned work you have put in. Even with its athlethic cut, your brain will know it is not workout fabric and the recovery and rest can begin while you still look amazing. Relax it down with a pair of Not for Jogging pants. High crop, so it also goes well with highwaisted sweatpants
column12: Tight; halter, high neck, high cropped

column7: This fitted tee is perfect with Not for Jogging pants, leggings and shorts.
column9: For those who have smaller shoulders or want a slightly more fitted tee but one that doesn't look like a box, this is your go-to. Super soft fabric makes it clear this is not for performance, it is for relaxation.
column10: Get your recovery started with a super soft T-shirt that is fitted but not snug. Easy to move in but also easy to relax in, the fit and fabric of the tea. Let your brain know it's time to rest.

column7: Wear it with leggings or shorts
column9: Sometimes it is hard to find a T-shirt that looks cute, but allows room for the big shoulders and lots of swimmers and upper body endurance athletes. This cute copped tee shows off the abs without a tight fit up top; loose shoulders and armpits for the swimmers.
column10: Loose and airy with soft fabric is perfect after you've worked hard in tight, performance upperware.
column12: Loose in shoulders, cropped for average height

column7: With leggings, shorts
column9: For the babes out there who want to show off a little but not be hemmed in by tighness. Perfect to wear to the outdoor pool winter workouts, around town. Boxy shoulders combined with tight abs gives you the perfect balance of athletic form witout the pretence and overall tightness.
column10: You'll want to wear this after you've rested a bit and are ready to hit the world; the cozy snug on the abs combined with the room up top let's you still feel and move like an athlete without the tight, performance fabrics you need on the long haul workouts. Pairs really well with a loose garmet underneath and still has room for the big shoulders

column6: Pale Grey Heather, Midnight Heather, Spring Heather
column7: With a cropped and/or tight top to offset the loose bottoms
column9: While someone named these "joggers" once upon a time, we know you are not running in these unless its after a dog or a kid (and let's be honest you won't break a real sweat doing that). These are the oh feel so good loose yet fitted pants you will want after every workout once the need for compression has passed. Has the benefit of drapping just perfectly off well-rounded glutes, giiving you the right amout of attention.
column10: Post-compression it is good to let your legs breathe a bit without the tight confines of leggings. These pants are the perfect signal to the brain that you're ready for the next phase of recovery. The super soft fabric feels just right - clearly we are not going to the office, but we are also not going to bed yet. Paired with a fitted tank these can go the off-duty distance on errands, long walks our lounging on the couch.
column12: Loose upper, somewhat tight calf cuff

column6: black, blue gem, Flower Blue Heather
column7: With a loose Cropped Tee, Fitted Tank; if chilly, add the Cropped Corset Fleece Jacket
column9: These leggings are extremely soft with just the right about of compression. The high waist makes them less "gym" and more "every day" non-workout.
column10: Compression is well known as beneficial for legs after long or hard workouts as it returns blood flow through the body. These compression leggings are a level 1 - light compression, for when you just need a little bit of tightness on the legs post-workout.  Supersoft, buttery fabric means you aren't working out in these but instead relaxing.

column6: Sea Spray Green, Deep Navy, Black
column7: Match it with the High Crop halter tank and a cartigan
column9: These leggings are extremely soft with just the right about of compression. The high waist makes them less "gym" and more "every day" non-workout.
column10: Compression is well known as beneficial for legs after long or hard workouts as it returns blood flow through the body. These compression leggings are a level 1 - light compression, for when you just need a little bit of tightness on the legs post-workout.  Supersoft, buttery fabric means you aren't working out in these but instead relaxing.

column7: Anytime
column9: These amazing boots feel so good you'll crave them every day. Gold technologies and a rugged rubber sole to create the ultimate cold weather footwear, perfect for cabins, camping, and après ski.
column10: Boots so cozy there is no way you're doing anything but recovering; soles so tough you can wear them out and about.

column7: Over a tank, tee and with leggings
column9: So cozy and thick, you'll be glad you did! Warm for the cool days, and great to wear over a tank or tee
column10: Perfect for removing the chill post workout, and so thick and luxurious you for sure are not working out in it.

column7: To keep your car seat protected after your workout. Comes in winter weight to also hold in warmth after those chilly workouts and summer weight when its all about the sweat.
Solo with a tank, sweatshirt or tee - these shorts go with everything. They even work for bed!
column9: These breathable, lightweight shorts support without gym-tightness. Supremely soft and innovative fabric gives you performance stretch knit that moves with you. So soft you may even want to sleep in them.
column10: These shorts provide just the right amount of compression to the upper thigh and lower core, supporting you just a little after a long workout. Their super soft feel let's your brain relax and know that work time is over, but if you had to chase a dog or a kid in these, they'd go the miles.

column7: Over your workout clothes or for after
column9: This washable puffer is meant for warmth right after you finish your workout. Since you should still be generating heat (but want to prevent yourself from losing it), this puffer is medium weight and packable so you can always bring it with you.  Despite the name, there is no down in there so it is easily washable and can handle your sweat!
column10: After your chilly workouts the post-workout chill really can set in, and set in fast. Once your core temperature has dropped it is hard to get it back up. Throw on this puffer immediately, before you cool down, to keep that temperature regulated. Recovery starts before your workout ends, so keeping yourself warm throughout only hastens the process. All your calories and efforts go to recovery and not to teeth chattering or warming up a chilled body.
column12: Medium density, loose fit, long to cover more

column1: Bring it just in case jacket
column7: If you need it, or after a light session and you need to cut the chill a bit.
column9: This is the jacket that is late enough and sin enough but also warm enough that you want to bring with you on any work out that is not summer or a warm climate. You never know when you might enjoy yourself or need to walk, and then anything but a summer climb at the body temperature could plummet rapidly. Doing everything you can to keep record temperature high we're walking back to your car can be the difference of extreme discomfort or already starting recovery. Lightweight, packable, and he trapping.
column10: If recovery has to start on the trail, or perhaps before the work out is over for one reason or another, this is the jacket you want with you. Specifically designed to be lightweight, it traps body heat when you need it most. Best to not work out in it, but save it for immediately after or maybe for the last few miles. One of the only hybrid workout/recovery items we sell.

column7: with a cropped top and if needing more, a cropped outer layer
column9: Full length, thick sweatpants in great fabric.
column10: For the days after a long, cold session and you really need to feel warm and cozy, these sweatpants leave no doubt that your body is in recovery and on its way to cozy warmth.

column7: With your leggings or shorts for added warmth; cozy over a tank
column9: This cartigan is oh-so amazing in cashmere with a classy look and front zip. Pairs with anything from your jeans to leggings or even shorts.
column10: Nothing says recovery like cashmere. For when the post-workout chill sets in a bit, you can reach for this number to keep you cozy.

column7: With your favorite matched set leggings and tank or bra top
column9: This button up sweater is perfect for throwing over your athlethic fit clothes such as our leggings and tank, but reminds you that you are done with the endurance work for the day! So soft a classy, you'll wear it all the time.
column10: No one works out in cashmere, so enough said.

column7: Over your gym clothes when you're done, or over your leggings and tank combo
column9: Cozy and cute, but with fabric just right to hit the wash as often as you need it.
column10: As soon as your workout is over, especially after a good functional strength session, you need something warm and light to throw on. This cartigan is meant for post-workout wear, and is cute enough you might also get a second one for after the shower recovery too.

column7: With baggy pants or high-wasted leggings; fitted crop tank underneath
column12: Roomy in shoulders, corsette waist, cropped

column7: With jeans, leggings, and shorts
column9: Loose but fitted and not too long, this super soft long sleeved tee is perfect with jeans, leggings, skirts and shorts.  Pretty much any outfit! Works as a nice overlayer for a slight chill in the air. It has a slight sateen shine which makes it fancier than a typical tee, so you'll want to wear it again and again.
column10: Just a bit too nice to wear to your workouts and give the loose vibes you want after a long workout, but does not have the boxy, unfitted fit of a cotton tee shirt from the swag bag. You'll know its chill time wearing this - whether at home or during the rest of your non-training life. A go to favorite.
column12: Loose but not boxy; not cropped but not long

column7: With jeans, leggings, shorts or joggers over a cropped tank
column9: The perfect fit, cropped sweatshirt removes the bulk but still provides the warmth you need. Ultracozy and ultra versatile it is perfect for all the life inbetween the workouts.
column10: Perfect for removing the chill post workout, and so thick and luxurious you for sure are not working out in it. The cropped look also gives your body some freedom to move without being overwhelmed by the bulk of fabric. Especially a favorite of petite athletes.

column7: With not for jogging, sweatpants or high waisted leggings
column9: This stylish (and let's be honest, amazing looking) tank is super cropped and yet super classy thanks to the draping crossover pattern and mesh detail. Supportive yet playful, this bra tank is great solo or under an open cardigan.
column10: This is for the athlete who always wants to be on the go, but is forced to take recovery time by the forces of nature and being human. This bra tank keeps you deeply connected to that workout vibe with its support, structure and high crop, yet is too dreamy to be sweating in.

column7: With a cropped tank or bra and loose cardigan if chilly
column9: Super stylish skirt goes from fancy to just barely toning down your athletic wear when paired with tight tank. Show off the upper body but add some feminine flow to the bottom.
column10: No way you're working out in this skirt, but it's flowy and loose enough to pair a set of cropped leggings underneath if you need the compression. This is for the athlete who wants to feel feminine and put-together while still honoring their athletic build. The loose, flowing fabric signals to your brain that you're off-duty and relaxing.
